record.attribute: you can review and combine search results

Go to "My Query History" to see the queries you have run (in your current browser session). From there you can view the results and combine results using AND, OR or NOT. You can also request a tab delimited report of your results.
you can browse multiple Plasmodium genomes at once

View the genomes of Plasmodium falciparum, Plasmodium vivax, and Plasmodium yoelii at the same time with the PlasmoDB Genomic Sequence Browser or through the PlasmoCD.

Access the genome browser with the "Gene Sequences" link on the home page. Or, from a Gene page or Genomic Sequence page, use the "View this sequence in the genome browser" link. In the browser, view syntenic relationships by choosing the Synteny and Syntenic genes tracks.

The PlasmoCD is accessible on-line via the PlasmoCD icon on the bottom left panel of most pages. Choosing any Plasmodium genome to explore will lead to list of Plasmodium GenePlot queries including one to Browse synteny between Plasmodium species.
In addition to fasta sequence files, the download site includes GFF files that contain rich annotation of each gene.
you can customize a tab-delimited report
From "My Query History" click "download" to custmoize a tab delimited report of your results.
you can retrieve all or part of a gene sequence
Use the "Gene Sequences" link from the home page to retrieve a set of gene sequences in fasta format. Customize the type of sequence and the region you would like to download

This site performs best when your browser allows cookies. In particular, the Gene page configuration uses cookies. Select show/hide for any section on the gene page. With cookies enabled, that selection will apply to all gene pages. With cookies disabled, moving to a new page will reset that selection

How to Enable Cookies(credit: http://www.google.com/cookies.html)

To enable cookies, follow the instructions below for the browser version you are using.

Mozilla Firefox (1.0 final release and earlier)
  • Go to the "Tools" menu.
  • Select "Options".
  • Select the "Privacy" icon in the left panel.
  • Check the box corresponding to "Allow sites to set cookies".
  • Click "OK" to save changes.
Netscape 7.1/Mozilla 5.0
  • Select "Preferences" from the Edit menu.
  • Click on the arrow next to "Privacy & Security" in the scrolling window to expand.
  • Under "Privacy & Security", select "Cookies."
  • Select "Enable all cookies".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0+
  • Select "Internet Options" from the Tools menu.
  • Click on the "Privacy" tab.
  • Click the "Default" button (or manually slide the bar down to "Medium") under "Settings".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.x
  • Select "Internet Options" from the Tools menu.
  • Click on the "Security" tab.
  • Click the "Custom Level" button.
  • Scroll down to the "Cookies" section.
  • To enable:
    • Set "Allow cookies that are stored on your computer" to "Enable".
    • Set "Allow per-session cookies" to "Enable".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.x
  • Select "Internet Options" from the View menu.
  • Click on the "Advanced" tab.
  • Scroll down to find "Cookies" within the "Security" section.
  • To enable:
    • Select "Always accept cookies".
  • Click "OK".
Netscape Communicator 4.x
  • Select "Preferences" from the Edit menu.
  • Find the "Cookies" section in the "Advanced" category.
  • To enable:
    • Select "Accept all cookies" (or "Enable all cookies").
  • Click "OK".
